Coronation: Rise to Power

The greatest ruler of the Maurya dynasty. Before becoming king, he was the governor of Taxila and Ujjain. His title was Devanampiya Piyadassi.

ЁЯХКя╕П
Kalinga War and Transformation

The Kalinga War (261 BCE) was a turning point in Ashoka's life. The horrors of the war are described in Ashoka's 13th Major Rock Edict. The bloodshed transformed his heart, and he abandoned the policy of war (Bherighosha) and adopted the policy of peace (Dhamma ghosa).

Transformed by the Kalinga War
тШ╕я╕П
Ashoka's Dhamma and Patronage
  • Ashoka's Dhamma: This was a code of ethics, not a new religion. Its main principles were non-violence, respect for elders, compassion towards slaves, and religious tolerance.
  • Propagation of Dhamma: He had his messages inscribed on edicts, appointed special officers called 'Dhamma Mahamattas', and sent Dhamma missions to countries like Syria, Egypt, Greece, and Sri Lanka. His son Mahinda and daughter Sanghamitra went to Sri Lanka.
  • Third Buddhist Council (c. 250 BCE): This was held in Pataliputra, presided over by Moggaliputta Tissa.
